suncertify.core
Class StringHelper

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.core.StringHelper

public final class StringHelper
extends Object

StringHelper is an utility class providing simple methods that operate on strings and string representation of different number types.

Author:
Przemyslaw Bielicki

Method Summary
static double doubleValue(String string)
          Returns double value of given string - if given string cannot be parsed (i.e. it throws NumberFormatException) this method returns 0d (zero).
static int intValue(String string)
          Returns int value of given string - if given string cannot be parsed (i.e. it throws NumberFormatException) this method returns 0 (zero).
static int intValue(String string, int defaultValue)
          Returns int value of given string - if given string cannot be parsed (i.e. it throws NumberFormatException) this method returns defaultValue (zero).
static String setStringLength(String string, int length)
          Returns given string with given length - if string is longer than required length the old string is cut to the new length; if string is shorter than required length its length is extended and filled with space (" ") sign.
static String toString(int value, int emptyValue)
          Returns string representation of given int or empty string ("") if given int value equals given emptyValue parameter.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

doubleValue

public static double doubleValue(String string)
Returns double value of given string - if given string cannot be parsed (i.e. it throws NumberFormatException) this method returns 0d (zero).

Parameters:
string - String - string representation of double number.
Returns:
double - double representation of given string or 0d (zero) if it cannot be parsed.
See Also:
Double.parseDouble(java.lang.String)

intValue

public static int intValue(String string,
                           int defaultValue)
Returns int value of given string - if given string cannot be parsed (i.e. it throws NumberFormatException) this method returns defaultValue (zero).

Parameters:
string - String - string representation of int number.
defaultValue - int - default value that is returned in case given string is invalid.
Returns:
int - int representation of given string or defaultValue (zero) if it cannot be parsed.
See Also:
Integer.parseInt(java.lang.String)

setStringLength

public static String setStringLength(String string,
                                     int length)
Returns given string with given length - if string is longer than required length the old string is cut to the new length; if string is shorter than required length its length is extended and filled with space (" ") sign.

Parameters:
string - String - string to be tailored to the new length.
length - int - new length of given string.
Returns:
String - tailored string to the new length.
See Also:
AbstractStringBuilder.setLength(int)

toString

public static String toString(int value,
                              int emptyValue)
Returns string representation of given int or empty string ("") if given int value equals given emptyValue parameter.

Parameters:
value - int - int value to be converted into String.
emptyValue - - if given value equals this value this method will return empty string ("") instead of string representation of value.
Returns:
String - string representation of given int or empty string ("").
See Also:
Integer.toString(int)
